title: Forever and a Day - 1943 [78 stars in one Great Picture!] WWII
description:
Forever and a Day (1943 - USA)

Drama / History

cast includes:
Donald Crisp, Cedric Hardwicke, Arthur Treacher, Dame May Whitty, Anna Neagle
Herbert Marshall, Ray Milland, Gene Lockhart, Claude Rains, Charles Laughton
C. Aubrey Smith, Buster Keaton, Ida Lupino, Merle Oberon, Nigel Bruce
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0035897/


Lobby card - 78 stars in one Great Picture!

This film has more credited writers than any other.

All cast and crew worked without pay as an aid to war propaganda.

Alfred Hitchcock prepared the sequence involving Ida Lupino, and was to have directed it; scheduling prevented him, and it was directed by RenÃ© Clair, who used Hitchcock's script.

The story of a house in London, built in 1804 by one Admiral Eustace Trimble, and of a few of the people who lived in it down to the present war, when it serves as a public air-raid shelter until a bomb hits it one night.


Video: MPEG4 Video (H264), 592x448, 23.980 fps, 572 Kbps, 01h46m00s
Audio: MP3, 48000 Hz, joint stereo, 128 kbps

DVDRip, film print obviously not restored, English audio, no subtitles
